data.title: Fix non-looping animations not being reset properly in AnimationTreePlayer
data.body:
When AnimationTreePlayer switches to new animation it never
seeks it to 0 which leads to problems with non-looping animations being
played just once.

This patch is direct approach fixing this problem.
It handles most common cases of occurance.

Closes #2199

data.title: UI font is too small on Mac(retina)
data.body: Compiled from source, and the ui font is very small on mac(retina).

data.title: Function to calculate a ColorRamp's color at a given value
data.body:
I'd like to ask for a method in ColorRamp to return a color according to a value between 0 and 1. Such as having 0,0,0,0 and 255,255,255,255 as colors in the ramp, and this function would return Color(128,128,128,128) with 0.5 as input.
While the ColorRamp class has methods to get the values to interpolate manually, it'd be really convenient to have that built-in.

data.title: PhysicsDirectBodyState.get_total_density() doesn't exists.
data.body: On latest master version, PhysicsDirectBodyState.get_total_density() method doesn't found at running Platformer 3D.

data.title: FBO-based MSAA support.
data.body:
This branch adds support for classic multisample antialiasing through the framebuffer method. While this type of antialiasing is performance intensive and won't be compatibile with any deferred rendering pipelines, if you're using a forward renderer and you've got the performance to spare, it will give you probably the best picture quality, vastly exceeding FXAA in my opinion. Screenshots for comparision:
https://galateaproject.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/no_aa.png
https://galateaproject.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/fxaa.png
https://galateaproject.files.wordpress.com/2015/11/msaa.png

data.title: Debugger closes after closing a running game.
data.body: When the debugger is set to stay (in the script view, debug > show debugger), it'll always close after running and closing a game. It'd be ideal if it stayed open if explicitly set to show.

data.title: X copy/paste buffers, inability to paste with middle-mouse button in gd editor
data.body:
I am no X expert but I think there are two copy/paste buffers under X. 
When I am writing gd code in Godot I cannot copy (via highlighting from xterm) into my gd script by using the middle-mouse button.  I looked around and did not see any settings for Godot regarding this.

Did I miss this or is this a feature? I can copy/paste from X apps that use ctrl-c,ctrl-v but I cannot use the other X buffer accessed via highlighting and middle-mouse click.

I tried with git version and 1.1-stable.

data.title: TextEdit: Scroll while selecting with mouse idle
data.body:
The last enhancement missing on #2364
Selecting and scrolling with the cursor outside the TextEdit rect will now work when mouse is idle too.

data.title: Fix tscn format not being recongnized by EditorFileSystem
data.body: Closes #2947.

data.title: Fix project manager not picking up custom font
data.body: Closes #1496.

data.title: Fix windows build
data.body:
Fixes regression introduced by me in #2956. (#3024 tracks this).

Build to confirm it in fact fixes the build is still running, will post here on success or no success.

data.title: LightOccluder in Tilemaps loosing their lightmask
data.body:
When using LightOccluders on different light masks in a tileset scene, the light masks will be reset to 1 after convert to TileSet.
After a quick view in the generated tileset.xml it seems to me, that the light mask info isn't stored there.
Converting it to a .res file instead of .xml has the same issue.

data.title: error building windows template with mingw
data.body:
drivers/unix/os_unix_global_settings_path.cpp:2:1: error: 'String' does not name a type

when building with:
scons platform=windows tools=no target=release_debug bits=64 -j 8

data.title: GDScript: or-expression evaluation
data.body:
Following code would invoke call_node function even if first part of or-expression (condition == null) succeeds:

``` gdscript
if condition == null or call_node( condition ):
     # whatever
```

This is different from how Python or C++ would evaluate such expression. Is this an intended behavior?

data.title: Updated aes256 implementation
data.body:
Updated aes256 implementation to newer version from upstream.  Also uses faster lookup table implemetation.

Closes #3012

data.title: Segfault last build
data.body:
When I try to start godot it segfault..
![segfault](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7677575/11669956/5b621a24-9e10-11e5-8a67-510d4defd710.png)

data.title: Option/cli switch to not start the editor maximized
data.body:
Could an option or command line switch be added to prevent the editor to start maximized? While the default (which can remain default) is convenient for smaller screens that benefit from a single maximized window, it gets a bit in the way when one has windows at a side for terminal tasks, collaboration tools, artwork references/editors and such things. 
An option to remember last window state (position and size/maximized status) could be convenient too.

data.title: Spinbox update range on mouse held
data.body:
Initial delay is 600 ms. After first tick, it's set to 75 ms for Spinbox and 50 ms for Tree ranges.

Closes #868

data.title: Areas now calculate their dampenings the same way as their gravity.
data.body:
For AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE:
Previously, only the gravity was the sum of all areas' gravities. Now the dampenings are the sum of all areas' dampenings, too.

data.title: Several Instances With The Same Name, first instance is named correct, following will be renamed
data.body:
I am creating several instances of the same scene with gdScript, so I will get several copies of one scene, all with the same name, scale etc.. 

But the name is changed. It looks like:

print(levelFragments)
[levelFrag1, @spatial1, @spatial3, @spatial4, ...]

How it should have looked:

print(levelFragments)
[levelFrag1, levelFrag2, levelFrag3, levelFrag4, ...]

When adding nodes to the scene tree, Godot automatically adds and increases a number  at the end. But when adding instances from script, they lose their name.

data.title: AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE only combines gravity
data.body:
When areas overlap, and the top one uses AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE, only the gravity gets combined. The linear/angular dampenings are replaced.

Is this correct behavior?

data.title: PinJoint2D: Problem with collision of connected bodies
data.body:
When I connect a RigidBody to a static one by a PinJoint2D, they won't collide.
Further Rigidbodies added to that chain will collide with the static as expected.

![pinjoint2d_error_demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16130334/11649904/445f329e-9d84-11e5-851d-9c60dd274d7f.png)

data.title: Exporting All Resources Loses File Structure
data.body:
Problem: Export a project with a simple folder structure, and opt to export all resources.
Result: (Assume that the main scene is res://levels/level.xml) The exported executable will be unable to find res://levels/level.xml

Solution: Export same project, but opt to export all files.
Result: The exported executable will be able to find res://levels/level.xml

I have tested this on Arch Linux x86_64. Although I am not certain, when you choose to export all resources, it seems like the exporter is packaging all resources in the root of res://, regardless of folder structure.

data.title: transparent light occluder
data.body:
Is it possible, to set up kind of transparent light occluder?
Like every occluder consumes a given percentage of light and maybe changes the color.

With this I'd like to realise things like transparent objects (leaves, glass...) or in a tilemap make the light gone after 4 tiles or something to reduce the vision.

I think, that would feel a natural way to achieve those effects.

data.title: define BACK_TO_TABLES in aes256.cpp?
data.body:
Is there a reason the line
# define BACK_TO_TABLES

is commented out at the top of core/io/aes256.cpp?  From what I can gather, the current code skips the use of lookup tables, and instead calculates the needed data on the fly.  In my roughly measured experiments where I enabled encryption of my scripts, this gives me load times 3-4 times longer than the unencrypted scripts.  If I uncomment this line, so that it uses the lookup tables, I can no longer distinguish between the encrypted and unencrypted load times, which is great.  But I wonder if this is too good to be true, and using the lookup tables is a bad choice for some reason.  I was able to export my scripts encrypted using a slow, non-lookup table built binary, then load that data using the fast lookup table version, so it seems they both work correctly.

Shall I make a PR for this, enabling the lookup tables?  Does anyone know enough about this to comment on whether this is a good idea?  I should be able to do this through scons build scripts myself, but if this is an acceptable change, I see no reason to keep doing it the slow way by default.

data.title: parse_json returns int and not the new dictionary
data.body:
Two lines to parse a json that could also be done in one line.

See some Examples:

``` GDScript
# NOW
var dictionary = {}    
dictionary.parse_json(response)
return dictionary

# SUGGESTION
return {}.parse_json(response)

# OR
return Dictionary.parse_json(response)

# OR
return response.to_dict()

# OR
return response.parse_json()
```

**Bugsquad edit:** embedded code from http://pastebin.com/23yDJw36 to keep it permanently here.

data.title: AutoLoad auto set NodeName after selecting a script
data.body:
Is it possible to set the Node Name to the selected name of the script?

It is most of the time the same name as the script and the previous Node Name is not removed anyway so there is nothing to lose.

data.title: LineEdit mouse drag selection substring
data.body:
I am only able to select the complete string on a LineEdit with mouse left drag.

Selecting a substring is missing.

data.title: Javascript, Android, IPhone, OSX, etc... not present in platform
data.body:
I don't know is this is a regression or a temporary bug but when launching scons on the latest fork of godot nor of the Javascript, Android, IPhone or OSX platforms are present in the platform option(only windows, server, x11 and haiku).
I don't know if I misreaded something on the doc or anything else but it kinda seems weird that those doesn't show up b\c imo OSX and Android are kind of a big deal, so I just opened up the issue.

data.title: Fix LineEdit cursor
data.body: Fixes bug with _LineEdit::set_cursor_at_pixel_pos_. Cursor was always set to the text length or zero.
